description: From 6th-century Latin multiplicativus, from Classical Latin multiplicāre (“to multiply”).

entries.meaning: (mathematics, of a function, etc.) Distributive over multiplication.
examples:
Matrix determinants are multiplicative; if 
  
    
      
        A
      
    
    {\displaystyle A}
  
 and 
  
    
      
        B
      
    
    {\displaystyle B}
  
 are square matrices of the same size, then 
  
    
      
        
          
            det
          
        
        (
        A
        B
        )
        =
        
          
            det
          
        
        (
        A
        )
        
        
          
            det
          
        
        (
        B
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle {\mbox{det}}(AB)={\mbox{det}}(A)\,{\mbox{det}}(B)}
  
.

entries.meaning: (grammar) A grammatical adverbial case in Finnish.
